Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: CORE IDENTIFIER : Unique identifier assigned to each physical core within aborehole.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the cored interval.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.7: CORE BARREL SIZE: Diameter of the core barrel used during the coring operation.
Column Comment.8: CORE BARREL SIZE OUOM: Barrel size original unit of measure.
Column Comment.9: CORE DIAMETER: Diameter of the core from well core drilling.
Column Comment.10: CORE DIAMETER OUOM: Core diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: CORE HANDLING: Identifies the type of technique used to preserve the core. Forexample, wrapped in plastic or fiberglass sleeve.
Column Comment.12: CORE ORIENTED INDICATOR: Y(es) or N(o) indicating the core was oriented. Anoriented core sample is taken with the side of the core marked by a blade so that theoriginal orientation can be determined.
Column Comment.13: SHOW TYPE: This table identifies the appearance of the hydrocarbons in the objectbeing evaluated. For example, show types can include Asphaltic stain, Bleeding gas,Oil fluorescence.
Column Comment.14: CORE TYPE: Defines the type of core procedure used during the coring operation.For example, conventional, sidewall, diamond, triangle etc
Column Comment.15: DRILLING MEDIA: Identifies the various drilling media type present in a wellbore.Commonly referred to as MUD TYPE. For example chemical gel mud, crude oil ornative mud.
Column Comment.16: DIGITS AVAILABLE INDICATOR: Y(es) or N(o) indicating the core is available indigital form.
Column Comment.17: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.18: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.19: GAMMA CORRELATION INDICATOR: Indicates gamma ray data was obtained fromthe analysis of the core.
Column Comment.20: OPERATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: Operation sequence number identifying thechronological order of drilling events.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.23: RECOVERED AMOUNT: Measured length of core recovered.
Column Comment.24: RECOVERED AMOUNT OUOM: Recovered core amount original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: RECOVERED AMOUNT UNITS OF MEASURE: the reported units of measure forrecovered amounts are normally feet or inches (FT or IN).
Column Comment.26: RECOVERY DATE: Date of the coring operation.
Column Comment.27: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.28: REPORTED CORE NUMBER: Data vendor assigned core number (usually internal).Maybe operator reported core number.
Column Comment.29: RUN NUMBER: Sidewall core run number. This is typically a number identifying aparticular visit by the sidewall coring company to the well site.
Column Comment.30: SHOT RECOVERED COUNT: Number of good shoots actually recovered from thisrun.
Column Comment.31: SIDEWALL CORE INDICATOR: A Yes or No flag indicating whether the informationis from a sidewall core sample .
Column Comment.32: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.33: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the cored interval.
Column Comment.34: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.35: TOTAL SHOT COUNT: The total number of sidewall cores attempted during theoperation.
Column Comment.36: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.37: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.38: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.39: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.40: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.41: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.42: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
